thread.title: 4 things sports fans are talking about tonight
thread.title_full: 4 things sports fans are talking about tonight

author: Jesse Campigotto
title: 4 things sports fans are talking about tonight
text:
4 things sports fans are talking about tonight Jays, Royals play Game 3 of ALCS on election day By Jesse Campigotto, CBC Sports Posted: Oct 19, 2015 3:32 PM ET Last Updated: Oct 19, 2015 3:32 PM ET Blue Jays fans will have to be in the lower levels at Rogers Centre if they want to buy a beer can during Game 3 of the ALCS. (Tom Szczerbowski/Getty Images) Related Stories Kadeisha Buchanan shortlisted for Ballon D'Or award 
Here's what Canadian sports fans are talking about for Monday evening (when they aren't voting or watching results from today's federal election ): 
1. The Blue Jays hope home-field advantage can help turn their American League Championship Series against Kansas City, who they trail two games to none heading into tonight's contest at Rogers Centre (8 p.m. ET). Game 3 starter Marcus Stroman encouraged Toronto fans to vote early because he's "going to need the city as rowdy and crazy as possible." 
2. Jays fans in the 500 level won't be allowed to buy beer in cans during the ALCS, the team announced today. The move to cups in the upper deck is a reaction to the ugly incident that occurred in the deciding game of the ALDS against Texas, when fans showered the field with aluminum after a controversial call. 
3. Canadian defender Kadeisha Buchanan was named as one of 10 candidates for the women's Ballon D'Or, which goes to the top international soccer player of the year. Buchanan, who's only 19, won the Young Player Award at this year's Women's World Cup, and was the lone Canadian named to the tournament's all-star team. 
4. The only NHL game of the night pits the Sharks against the Rangers at Madison Square Garden. Pacific-leading San Jose (4-1-0) is expected to start Martin Jones, who has a sparkling 0.49 GAA while winning all four of his starts. New York (3-2-1) plans to sit star goalie Henrik Lundqvist for the first time this season and go with backup Antti Raanta.
